TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit SystemIcons extends System.Object

summary.span: 类的每个属性都是 Windows 系统级图标的 对象。

span.span: Each property of the class is an object for Windows system-wide icons.
This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何加载从位图处理，使用枚举，以及如何使用方法，以便绘制的矩形边界的位图。The following code example demonstrates how to load a bitmap from an handle, using the enumeration, and the use of the method to draw the rectangle bounds of a bitmap. 本示例旨在与 Windows 窗体一起使用。This example is designed to be used with Windows Forms. 创建包含名为 Button2 的按钮的窗体。Create a form that contains a button named Button2. 将代码粘贴到窗体并将此方法与按钮的关联`Click`事件。Paste the code into the form and associate this method with the button's `Click` event. [!code-cpp[System.Drawing.BitmapMembers#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Drawing.BitmapMembers/CPP/form1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Drawing.BitmapMembers#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Drawing.BitmapMembers/CS/form1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Drawing.BitmapMembers#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Drawing.BitmapMembers/VB/form1.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Drawing.Icon Application { get; }
.property class System.Drawing.Icon Application
Public Shared ReadOnly Property Application As Icon
public: static property System::Drawing::Icon ^ Application { System::Drawing::Icon ^ get(); };

summary.span: 获取 对象，它包含默认的应用程序图标 (WIN32: IDI_APPLICATION)。

span.span: Gets an object that contains the default application icon (WIN32: IDI_APPLICATION).

value.span: 对象，它包含默认的应用程序图标。

span.span: An object that contains the default application icon.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 用户帐户控制 (UAC) 指南建议使用防火墙图标旁边或在其默认操作是需要提升至管理员特权任意控件上。The User Account Control (UAC) guidelines recommend the use of the shield icon next to or on any control whose default action is to require an elevation to administrator privileges. 有关详细信息，请参阅 MSDN 上的"Windows Vista 用户体验指南"的"用户帐户控制"部分。For more information, see the "User Account Control" section of the "Windows Vista User Experience Guidelines" on MSDN.
